Title: Describing Syntax and Semantics
Lexeme: The lowest level syntactic unit of a language (e.g., *, def, start, etc.)

Symbols.;: Statement before this then statement after this

Definitions.Non Terminals: A finite alphabet (ie X, Y, Z)
Definitions.Terminals: Characters which cannot be substituted further (ie a, b, c)
Definitions.Start Symbols: The initial symbol to produce the alphabet with (ie X)
Definitions.Productions: Available substitutions for characters to create stirngs (ie X -> aX: This means that X can be substituted by aX in our language)
